display_asset.caption: “Campbell’s Soup Cans” paintings by Andy Warhol were displayed at the Museum of Modern Art in New York last year. The stolen prints were based on these paintings.
display_asset.credit: Emon Hassan for The New York Times

summaries.body: Seven screen prints of Andy Warhol’s Campbell’s Soup cans were snatched from an art museum in Springfield, Mo. The F.B.I. has offered a $25,000 reward.

display_asset.caption: Ali al-Amin with the two children. The children were abducted last week by three “armed persons.” Their mother and eight others face charges.

summaries.body: An Australian woman and eight other people, including four journalists, are facing criminal charges in Lebanon after she tried to take her two children from her Lebanese ex-husband.

display_asset.caption: James Taylor is retiring after it was discovered he has a heart condition.

summaries.body: The English cricket star James Taylor is retiring at age 26 after being diagnosed with a serious heart condition.

display_asset.caption: Lt. Cmdr. Edward C. Lin of the United States Navy, a native of Taiwan, speaking at a naturalization ceremony in Honolulu in 2008.
display_asset.credit: Sarah Murphy/US NAVY, via Associated Press

summaries.body: Taiwan's military said it had not received secrets from an American naval officer under investigation on suspicion of providing information to Taiwan or China.

display_asset.caption: Keegan-Michael Key, left, and Jeff Probst on MadTV in 2008.

summaries.body: “MadTV” is returning for eight episodes on the CW network. The sketch comedy series ran for 14 years and started the careers of the comedy duo Key and Peele, among others.

display_asset.caption: A poster in the Indian state of Kerala shows three of the more than 100 victims of the explosion at Puttingal temple.

summaries.body: Thirteen people have been arrested in connection with the explosions that killed more than 100 during a fireworks display at a temple in southern India over the weekend.

display_asset.caption: Opponents of North Carolina’s new law on gay and transgender rights protested outside the State Capitol in Raleigh on Monday.
display_asset.credit: Ray Whitehouse for The New York Times

summaries.body: North Carolina's new law on gay and transgender rights has deepened political rifts in a state that has long been considered one of the South's most moderate.
The Belgian authorities have charged two more men with offenses related to the Brussels bombings.
The butlers, florists and chefs who are a permanent part of the White House’s staff are following the election closely. Our next president is their new boss.

display_asset.caption: The Turkish Embassy has requested that Germany prosecute the television comic and satirist Jan Böhmermann under a little-known law on insulting foreign leaders.
display_asset.credit: Jörg Carstensen/Deutsche Presse-Agentur, via Associated Press

summaries.body: A German comedian's takedown of President Recep Tayyip Erdogan of Turkey may have run afoul of a little-known German law on insulting foreign leaders.
Prosecutors in Italy say a secretive mafia used a legitimate business selling flowers to conceal drugs and expand its reach into dozens of countries.

display_asset.caption: Police officers inspected the roof of an HSBC bank branch in Borough Park, Brooklyn, on Monday after employees discovered a tunnel carved into its vault and money missing. The break-in probably happened over the weekend, the police said.
display_asset.credit: Michael Nagle for The New York Times

summaries.body: Thieves stole $280,000 from a bank in Brooklyn by carving a hole in the ceiling and tunneling into a vault. Customers' deposits will not be affected, the bank said.

display_asset.caption: A yellow-eyed penguin on New Zealand’s Enderby Island.

summaries.body: The shy yellow-eyed penguin in New Zealand faces extinction despite conservation efforts. Only 2,000 of the birds remain, making it the rarest species of penguin.

display_asset.caption: Eddie Redmayne as Newt Scamander in “Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them.”

summaries.body: In a new trailer for the "Harry Potter" spinoff, viewers see more of its protagonist (Eddie Redmayne) in the film's period New York setting.
A Texas law enforcement officer who was filmed slamming a 12-year-old student to the ground at a San Antonio middle school has been fired, officials said.

display_asset.caption: A Royal Bengal Tiger at Kaziranga National Park in India in 2014.

summaries.body: Wild tiger numbers rose this year for the first time in more than a century, wildlife groups say. New technology, including hidden cameras, helped to track and count them.

display_asset.caption: The new tree of life that researchers published on Monday. It shows that much of Earth’s biodiversity is bacteria, top, half of which includes “candidate phyla radiation” that are still waiting to be discovered. Humans are in the bottom branch of eukaryotes.
display_asset.credit: Jill Banfield/UC Berkeley, Laura Hug/University of Waterloo

summaries.body: Behold the new tree of life. One scientist called it "an entire continent of life-forms." Researchers found that bacteria make up most of the branches.

display_asset.caption: Peter Kang, a high school senior in Chantilly, Va., applied to 21 colleges.

summaries.body: After a student was accepted to all the Ivy League schools, not everyone was cheering. Some say the Common Application system distorts elite college admissions.

display_asset.caption: Jamaica Ponder, a junior at Princeton High School in New Jersey. She wrote a blog post about classmates of hers who had played a drinking game called “Jews vs. Nazis.”
display_asset.credit: Nancy Wegard for The New York Times

summaries.body: A Princeton High School student took offense to, and posted a photo of, classmates playing a beer pong game called "Jews vs. Nazis." Outrage engulfed the student and the players.

display_asset.caption: A portrait of a new Afghan Muppet from “Sesame Street” called Zari.

summaries.body: The Afghan "Sesame Street," financed by the State Department, introduced a Muppet named Zari, a 6-year-old girl who teaches empowerment and health.

display_asset.caption: Howard Marks with a copy of his autobiography, “Mr. Nice,” at the premiere in Munich of its movie adaptation, in 2011.

summaries.body: Howard Marks, a British author, performer and former cannabis smuggler who wrote ​the best-selling memoir "Mr. Nice"​ after his release from a U.S. prison, has died at 70.

display_asset.caption: Traffic during afternoon rush hour in Jakarta, the capital of Indonesia, last week.
display_asset.credit: Rony Zakaria for The New York Times

summaries.body: The notoriously bad traffic in Jakarta, Indonesia, has become even worse with the suspension of a car pool rule in response to children being used as passengers for hire.

display_asset.caption: Michael Rapino of Live Nation Entertainment said the high risks of starting festivals made it attractive to acquire proven entities.
display_asset.credit: Coley Brown for The New York Times

summaries.body: With a deal to acquire a majority stake in Founders Entertainment, Live Nation has added Governors Ball in New York to its lineup of music festivals.
Early on Friday, a man broke into a Five Guys branch in Washington and cooked himself a cheeseburger.

display_asset.caption: The Boston Globe’s satirical mockup of what its front page might look like if Donald Trump won the presidency.

summaries.body: In "an exercise in taking a man at his word," The Boston Globe published a parody front page that envisioned the news stories under a Donald J. Trump presidency.
The projected financial impact of a billionaire resident's departure has alarmed New Jersey lawmakers so much that some have suggested changing the state's tax structure.

display_asset.caption: Hilde produced a video rebuttal to her critics that got widespread attention.

summaries.body: A 9-year-old journalist from Pennsylvania became a media sensation after breaking a story on a homicide in her neighborhood and making a video rebutting her critics.

display_asset.caption: Bruce Springsteen and the E Street Band performing in 2012.

summaries.body: Bruce Springsteen canceled a North Carolina concert to protest a new law on gay and transgender rights. “Some things are more important than a rock show,” he said.

display_asset.caption: Officer Brian Hamilton of the Indiana State Police.

summaries.body: An Indiana state trooper was fired for proselytizing during traffic stops. He pulled one woman over for an illegal pass then asked if she “accepted Jesus Christ as her savior.”

display_asset.caption: Donald J. Trump in 2007 when his star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame was unveiled, with his wife Melania and sons Donald Jr. (left) and Barron.

summaries.body: Donald J. Trump’s Hollywood star occupies prime real estate, next to Kevin Spacey. But it has been repeatedly vandalized with paint, graffiti and other markings.
